p: Very recently, an increase in dialogue between Cuban and United States researchers created an opportunity to build mutual understanding of phytosanitary institutions and policies. In 2015, a joint statement on cooperation for environmental protection was signed between the United States and Cuban governments to increase cooperation and facilitate the exchange of scientific information [ 24]. Notably, in 2016, the USDA and the MINAG (Cuban Ministry of Agriculture) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the objective of establishing bilateral cooperation in the agricultural and forestry sectors, including plant health issues, standards of agricultural trade, and scientific exchange [ 25].
